<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 14"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Night's Warning](/Feats.aspx?ID=4073) <actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Occult" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=120" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #187: The Seventh Arch](/Sources.aspx?ID=192) pg. 83

**Archetype** [Oatia Skysage](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=199)

**Frequency**
once per hour

**Prerequisites**
[Oatia Skysage Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=4064)

**Trigger**
A creature targets you with an attack and you can see the attacker.

**Requirements**
You can see the night sky.

</column>

---

Portents written in the night sky show you how to avoid an attack. The triggering attack roll targets your [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) DC instead of your AC. Though this allows you to avoid taking penalties to your AC, it doesn't remove any conditions or other effects causing such penalties. For example, an enemy with [sneak attack](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=34) would still deal extra damage to you for being [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16), even though you wouldn't take the –2 circumstance penalty when defending against the attack.
name: Night's Warning
requirement: You can see the night sky.
